description.zh-cn: 在印度与南亚其他地区普遍存在的一种社会体系，以婆罗门为中心，划分出许多以职业为基础的内婚制群体。虽在法律上已被废除，但在现实社会中仍有深远影响。
description.en: A social system prevalent in India and other parts of South Asia, centered around the Brahmins, dividing society into numerous endogamous groups based on occupation. Although legally abolished, it still has a profound impact on contemporary society.

description.zh-cn: 据信于公元前1500年左右入侵印度并创立了种姓制度的古代民族。
description.en: An ancient people believed to have invaded India around 1500 BCE and established the caste system.

description.zh-cn: 印度的原住民之一，在雅利安人入侵后被征服。
description.en: One of the aboriginal peoples of India, who were conquered after the Aryan invasion.

description.zh-cn: 由释迦牟尼创立的宗教，宣扬众生平等，旨在反对不平等的种姓制度。
description.en: A religion founded by Gautama Buddha, which preaches the equality of all living beings and was established in opposition to the unequal caste system.

description.zh-cn: 由大雄创立的宗教，与佛教类似，也宣扬众生平等并反对种姓制度。
description.en: A religion founded by Mahavira, which, similar to Buddhism, also preaches the equality of all living beings and opposes the caste system.

description.zh-cn: 信仰该宗教的马木留克、蒙兀尔等外来征服者在统治印度期间，在一定程度上瓦解了种姓制度。
description.en: The rule of its followers, such as the Mamluks and Mughals, who were foreign conquerors in India, contributed to the weakening of the caste system to some extent.

description.zh-cn: 英国在印度次大陆的殖民统治时期。在此期间，西方的平权思想对印度的种姓制度产生了巨大冲击。
description.en: The period of British colonial rule on the Indian subcontinent. During this time, Western ideas of equal rights had a significant impact on India's caste system.

description.zh-cn: 印度于1947年获得独立，此后种姓制度被正式从法律上废除。
description.en: India gained independence in 1947, after which the caste system was officially abolished by law.

description.zh-cn: 印度独立后制定的宪法，其中第15条和第17条明文规定禁止种姓歧视并废除“不可接触制”。
description.en: The constitution enacted after India's independence, which explicitly prohibits caste-based discrimination and abolishes "untouchability" in Articles 15 and 17.

description.zh-cn: 印度民族解放运动的领导人，曾致力于劝说印度人民放弃种姓制度。
description.en: A leader of the Indian independence movement who worked to persuade the Indian people to abandon the caste system.

description.zh-cn: 印度教经典中解释种姓制度的理论分类架构，将社会分为婆罗门、刹帝利、吠舍和首陀罗四个阶层。
description.en: A theoretical classification framework in Hindu scriptures that explains the caste system, dividing society into four classes: Brahmin, Kshatriya, Vaishya, and Shudra.

description.zh-cn: 印度种姓制度中最高等的瓦尔那，传统上为祭司和学者，是整个阶序的核心。
description.en: The highest varna in the Indian caste system, traditionally comprising priests and scholars, and forming the core of the social hierarchy.

description.zh-cn: 印度种姓制度中的次等瓦尔那，传统上为战士和统治者，掌握政治与军事权力。
description.en: The second varna in the Indian caste system, traditionally comprising warriors and rulers, holding political and military power.

description.zh-cn: 印度种姓制度中第三等的瓦尔那，传统上为农人、牧人及商人。
description.en: The third varna in the Indian caste system, traditionally comprising farmers, herdsmen, and merchants.

description.zh-cn: 印度种姓制度中最低等的瓦尔那，传统上为奴仆，负责提供各种服务。
description.en: The lowest varna in the Indian caste system, traditionally comprising servants who provided various services.

description.zh-cn: 被排除在四个瓦尔那之外的群体，被视为“不可触碰”，传统上从事被认为不洁净的工作。
description.en: A group excluded from the four varnas, considered "untouchable," and traditionally engaged in occupations deemed impure.

description.zh-cn: 一部重要的早期婆罗门教经典，其中对瓦尔那分类架构有主要阐述。
description.en: An important early Brahmanical text that contains major expositions on the Varna classification framework.

description.zh-cn: 佛教的创始人，在教义中公开反对任何形式的种姓结构。
description.en: The founder of Buddhism, who openly opposed any form of caste structure in his teachings.

description.zh-cn: 耆那教的创始人，同样反对任何形式的种姓结构。
description.en: The founder of Jainism, who also opposed any form of caste structure.

description.zh-cn: 始于公元8世纪的印度教改革运动，运动中的许多圣人拒绝接受以种姓为基础的歧视。
description.en: A Hindu reform movement that began in the 8th century CE, in which many saints rejected caste-based discrimination.

description.zh-cn: 印度教改革者，相信印度教无种姓制度容身之地。
description.en: A Hindu reformer who believed there was no place for the caste system in Hinduism.

description.zh-cn: 2008年8月发生在印度比哈尔邦阿拉里亚的水灾。在此期间，身为贱民的灾民因受到歧视而得不到地方政府的任何协助。
description.en: A flood that occurred in Araria, Bihar, India, in August 2008. During the disaster, victims from the Dalit community did not receive any assistance from the local government due to discrimination.

description.zh-cn: 一般认为，印度种姓制度是随雅利安人入侵印度而创立的社会制度。
description.en: It is generally believed that the caste system in India was a social institution established following the invasion of the Aryans.

description.zh-cn: 雅利安人入侵印度次大陆时，征服了当地的住民达罗毗荼人。
description.en: When the Aryans invaded the Indian subcontinent, they conquered the local inhabitants, the Dravidians.

description.zh-cn: 佛教宣称众生平等，是为了反对不平等的种姓制度而创立的宗教。
description.en: Buddhism, which proclaims the equality of all living beings, was founded as a religion to oppose the unequal caste system.

description.zh-cn: 耆那教宣称众生平等，是为了反对不平等的种姓制度而创立的宗教。
description.en: Jainism, which proclaims the equality of all living beings, was founded as a religion to oppose the unequal caste system.

description.zh-cn: 信仰伊斯兰教的外来征服者统治印度，在一定程度上瓦解了种姓制度。
description.en: The rule of foreign conquerors who followed Islam in India weakened the caste system to some extent.

description.zh-cn: 在英属印度时期，由英国人带来的西方平权思想很大程度上冲击了种姓制度。
description.en: During the British Raj, Western ideas of equal rights brought by the British significantly impacted the caste system.

description.zh-cn: 1947年印度独立后，种姓制度被法律明令废除。
description.en: After India's independence in 1947, the caste system was officially abolished by law.

description.zh-cn: 印度宪法第15条和第17条明文规定禁止种姓歧视并废除“不可接触制”，从法律上废除了种姓制度。
description.en: Articles 15 and 17 of the Indian Constitution explicitly prohibit caste-based discrimination and abolish "untouchability," legally abolishing the caste system.

description.zh-cn: 甘地曾致力于劝说印度人民放弃种姓制度。
description.en: Gandhi worked to persuade the Indian people to abandon the caste system.

description.zh-cn: 古代印度的婆罗门发展出一套称为“瓦尔那”的分类架构，作为解释并简化整个种姓制度的方式。
description.en: The Brahmins of ancient India developed a classification framework called "Varna" to explain and simplify the entire caste system.

description.zh-cn: 瓦尔那理论的内涵主要见于《摩奴法典》等早期婆罗门教经典。
description.en: The substance of the Varna theory is primarily found in early Brahmanical texts such as the Manusmriti.

description.zh-cn: 作为统治阶级，婆罗门依靠剥削包括吠舍在内的中下阶层为生。
description.en: As a ruling class, the Brahmins lived by exploiting the middle and lower classes, including the Vaishyas.

description.zh-cn: 作为统治阶级，婆罗门依靠剥削包括首陀罗在内的中下阶层为生。
description.en: As a ruling class, the Brahmins lived by exploiting the middle and lower classes, including the Shudras.

description.zh-cn: 作为统治阶级，刹帝利依靠剥削包括吠舍在内的中下阶层为生。
description.en: As a ruling class, the Kshatriyas lived by exploiting the middle and lower classes, including the Vaishyas.

description.zh-cn: 作为统治阶级，刹帝利依靠剥削包括首陀罗在内的中下阶层为生。
description.en: As a ruling class, the Kshatriyas lived by exploiting the middle and lower classes, including the Shudras.

description.zh-cn: 瓦尔那理论规定，刹帝利负有保护婆罗门的职责。
description.en: According to Varna theory, the Kshatriyas have the duty to protect the Brahmins.

description.zh-cn: 释迦牟尼是佛教的创始人。
description.en: Gautama Buddha is the founder of Buddhism.

description.zh-cn: 佛教创始人释迦牟尼在教义中公开反对任何形式的种姓结构。
description.en: The founder of Buddhism, Gautama Buddha, openly opposed any form of caste structure in his teachings.

description.zh-cn: 笩駄摩那是耆那教的创始人。
description.en: Mahavira is the founder of Jainism.

description.zh-cn: 耆那教的创始人笩駄摩那反对任何形式的种姓结构。
description.en: The founder of Jainism, Mahavira, opposed any form of caste structure.

description.zh-cn: 虔诚派运动中的许多圣人拒绝接受所有以种姓为基础的歧视。
description.en: Many saints of the Bhakti movement refused to accept any caste-based discrimination.

description.zh-cn: 印度教改革者辨喜相信印度教无种姓制度容身之地。
description.en: Hindu reformer Swami Vivekananda believed there was no place for the caste system in Hinduism.

description.zh-cn: 在2008年比哈尔邦的水灾中，贱民灾民因受到歧视而得不到地方政府的任何协助，导致大量人员死亡。
description.en: During the 2008 Bihar flood, Dalit victims did not receive any assistance from the local government due to discrimination, resulting in a large number of deaths.
